verses.text: David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave Adullam : and when his brethren and all his father’s house heard \add it\add*, they went down thither to him.

And every one \add that was\add* in distress , and every one that \add was\add* in debt , and every one \add that was\add* discontented , gathered themselves unto him; and he became a captain over them: and there were with him about four hundred men.\f + \fr 22.2 \ft was in debt: Heb. had a creditor\f*\f + \fr 22.2 \ft discontented: Heb. bitter of soul\f* \p
¶ And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab : and he said unto the king of Moab , Let my father and my mother , I pray thee, come forth , \add and be\add* with you, till I know what God will do for me.
And he brought them before the king of Moab : and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the hold. \p
¶ And the prophet Gad said unto David , Abide not in the hold ; depart , and get thee into the land of Judah. Then David departed , and came into the forest of Hareth. \p

¶ When Saul heard that David was discovered , and the men that \add were\add* with him, (now Saul abode in Gibeah under a tree in Ramah , having his spear in his hand , and all his servants \add were\add* standing about him;)\f + \fr 22.6 \ft tree…: or, grove in a high place\f*

Then Saul said unto his servants that stood about him, Hear now , ye Benjamites ; will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards , \add and\add* make you all captains of thousands , and captains of hundreds ;

That all of you have conspired against me, and \add there is\add* none that sheweth me that my son hath made a league with the son of Jesse , and \add there is\add* none of you that is sorry for me, or sheweth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait , as at this day ?\f + \fr 22.8 \ft sheweth…: Heb. uncovereth mine ear\f* \p
¶ Then answered Doeg the Edomite , which was set over the servants of Saul , and said , I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob , to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.
And he enquired of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* for him, and gave him victuals , and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest , the son of Ahitub , and all his father’s house , the priests that \add were\add* in Nob : and they came all of them to the king.
And Saul said , Hear now, thou son of Ahitub. And he answered , Here I \add am\add*, my lord.\f + \fr 22.12 \ft Here…: Heb. Behold me\f*

And Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse , in that thou hast given him bread , and a sword , and hast enquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait , as at this day ?

Then Ahimelech answered the king , and said , And who \add is so\add* faithful among all thy servants as David , which is the king’s son in law , and goeth at thy bidding , and is honourable in thine house ?

Did I then begin to enquire of God for him? be it far from me : let not the king impute \add any\add* thing unto his servant , \add nor\add* to all the house of my father : for thy servant knew nothing of all this, less or more.\f + \fr 22.15 \ft less…: Heb. little or great\f*
And the king said , Thou shalt surely die , Ahimelech , thou, and all thy father’s house. \p

¶ And the king said unto the footmen that stood about him, Turn , and slay the priests of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; because their hand also \add is\add* with David , and because they knew when he fled , and did not shew it to me. But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 22.17  t footmen: or, guard: Heb. runners *

And the king said to Doeg , Turn thou, and fall upon the priests. And Doeg the Edomite turned , and he fell upon the priests , and slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod.
And Nob , the city of the priests , smote he with the edge of the sword , both men and women , children and sucklings , and oxen , and asses , and sheep , with the edge of the sword. \p
¶ And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub , named Abiathar , escaped , and fled after David.
And Abiathar shewed David that Saul had slain the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* priests.

And David said unto Abiathar , I knew \add it\add* that day , when Doeg the Edomite \add was\add* there, that he would surely tell Saul : I have occasioned \add the death\add* of all the persons of thy father’s house.
Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life : but with me thou \add shalt be\add* in safeguard.
